description:
Cash only.

Super good.

Came here before heading off to the II Giro di San Francisco Bike race. 

I got the number three on jalapeno bagel.

G got a number six on a garlic bagel.

I got to eat half of eat.

I love number six, I think I would prefer it on the jalapeno bagel instead. 

They were both good. 3 & 6 both have swiss. 6 is just more hearty with the sausage in it.
author: Lilian L.

description:
Quality little bagel shop. Great bagels and cream cheeses.  Fast service. Watch out they will run low on some flavors near the end of the day

My favorite: jalapeño bagel with veggie lite spread, bacon and tomato
author: Austin J.

description:
Came here for bagels at 730a, not open. Sign in window says open at 630a.

Have had bagels before, they're good.

Cash only, which feels strange in these times. Something to prepare for.
author: Daniel M.

description:
My wife grew up in Los Angeles, and as a bagel loving person of Jewish descent, she has always complained how hard it is to find a great deli in the Bay Area. Something that compares to Canters or Nate's Al.

Yes I took her to Wise and sons and other places in East Bay trying to find that perfect rugelach that wasn't too dry, no luck there.

So we settled for something that seemed easier - bagels. After trying many different delis and being disappointed, esp. Wise and sons, whose bagel wasn't bad but wasn't mind blowing either. 

When all hope was lost, we found Katz. Or she did. And the love affair has continued. I am a huge fan of everything bagel, toasted, with tomato, avocado, onion and capers. And occasionally some lox.

You cannot miss this joint in the Mission with the giant bagel facade. Keep enough cash handy. I usually buy a bunch and freeze them. Somehow it tastes better when you toast a flash frozen bagel.
Go figure!
author: Sam K.

description: Good bagel. Dirty bathroom.  The food here is pretty great for a quick morning stop. Fast and friendly service but I asked to use the bathroom to wash my hands and oh Nelly these guys need a janitor.
author: ben R.

description: I've been going here for a while on my commutes back home from the Castro to the East Bay, and I'm glad I found it. Definitely some of the best bagels I've found in the bay. I always get there lox spread which is affordable and filling. You can eat it there or easy to grab and go and hop on the BART. They also have good coffee. Last time I was there I got a great mocha. The chocolate was rich and enjoyable. Wide selection of bagels and they are toasted the perfect amount in my opinion. The atmosphere is chill and while it is usually cold and windy in the area, this place warms me right up. Good place to chill and talk with a friend or do some brief reading. Service is quick. I know I can always count on the folks at Katz to get me a good bagel and some coffee.
author: Chip W.

description:
Katz Bagels is my go-to bagel shop in The Mission. Actually, I believe it might be the only bagel shop in The Mission!

I am not a bagel connoisseur, in fact, I think the bagels are just ok. But I go to Katz for the spread. Definitely try the sun-dried tomoato!

*CASH MONEY ONLY!*
author: John L.

description:
There are few on the go breakfast places in the mission open early for those of us who get to work before 8am and don't have free breakfast it is hard to find an on the go place other than a Starbucks with a good breakfast sandwich. They do a good job, a little slow for an on the go breakfast but at least the coffee is palatable.  CASH ONLY THOUGH

I always ask for bagels double toasted, could really be triple toasted if you want that real crunch but it takes too long to wait for that. 
The egg and cheese and ham bagel is quite filling and yummy.
author: Morgan S.

description: Was kinda scared to go in not used to this neighborhood and the non descript building. After seeing a steady stream of customers going in and out thought we would give it a chance  as there is no other eating places around. Food was great, service was fast. Would go back.
author: Jay B.

description: Favorite coffee in SF! Very nice & friendly. I get the large latte, #4 bagel, and #5 w/ bacon whenever I have the time!
author: Alex N.

description:
I tend to be a stickler about bagels; you can blame the New Yorker in me.  I've tried Katz several times on my way to work, and while I feel it's better than what you can get at a Noah's Bagels, I'd rate their bagels on the "OK" side.

Service is speedy: I'm usually in and out there relatively quickly in the mornings that I've stopped by.  I usually just get one of their bagels with cream cheese, but they do offer egg breakfast sandwiches if that's your jam.  I tried an egg, cheese, and sausage sandwich and was quite underwhelmed: a thick layer of flavorless cheese with bland sausage did not leave me clamoring to repeat the experience.  However, if I'm in the neighborhood and need to have a bagel fix, there are definitely worse options than Katz.
author: Keith H.

description:
I've been meaning to stop by here ever since I saw the giant bagel with wings on the outside of the shop! 

When you walk in, you place your order at the bar. The staff is friendly, the decor is average and the bagels are good. I had a plain bagel with cream cheese that hit the spot! I'll be back. 

*CASH ONLY!
author: Kelly F.

description: Once you've experienced Katz breakfast bagels it's hard to go anywhere else. My fav is the #6 on whole wheat everything.  Only wish they made more whole wheat everything bagels bc if I don't get there before 9am they are often already out!
author: Shawna G.

description:
I would eat bagels here everyday if I had more money and, tbh, a salt deficiency.

The bagels are great, the people are great, the sign out front is great, the decorations inside are great.

Sesame #2 with a large coffee is where it's at. But beware: cash only.
author: Will C.

description:
A nice place to get a decent breakfast sandwich. The sausage, egg and basil bagel is respectable and worth the $5.50. Don't come here if you're looking for a good bagel. Come here if you're hungry and you want a filling breakfast sandwich. 

An everything bagel includes garlic. My so-called everything bagel did not. I like chewy poofy bagels that are almost, but not quite crispy on the outside. This bagel was almost chewy. The outside was almost right. But almost doesn't get you famous.

So, Katz, I know what you were trying to do when you picked that name. Not even close. But you are a clean institution with good service and for that I don't regret my purchase.
author: Cat M.

description: Well, apparently if you stop the person helping you from using their own cups when getting a cup of coffee and say you would like to use your own, they ostracize you from getting coffee and get so upset they have to get someone else to get it for you....  I'm sure it was a language barrier but maybe hire less sensitive people...
author: Christian M.

description: Delicious bagel with lox, cream cheese, tomatoes and capers! Very good cappuccino as well! Would recommend!
author: Dee H.

description:
I began getting bagels at Katz Bagels when I move here from NY in 2001. I had been spoiled by the best NY bagels and was pleasantly surprised to find delicious bagels here in SF.

I particularly liked their everything bagels, abundantly topped with a wide variety of seeds and more: sesame, poppy, garlic, onion, salt, fennel and caraway. These became my new "gold standard" of delicious bagels as a treat for breakfast or lunch, and I'd buy a dozen and keep them in my freezer.

Several months ago I went in and asked for everything bagels. I was surprised to be given bagels with just a sparse sprinkling of sesame and poppy seeds. I asked "Are these what you're offering as everything bagels? They're more like sesame and poppy combination bagels." The owner, Michael,  told me, "Yeah, you're right - I should talk to the baker." 

I went back several weeks later and found the bagels to be as ungenerously prepared. I asked if Michael had spoken to the baker and he told me that he had not.

Fast forward two weeks: I went in, and when I saw the same bagels, stingily seeded, I said "These are really disappointing - they used to have so many more seeds on them." Michael replied "If you're disappointed go to another bagel store!" and he proceeded to list a number of other bagel store options.

Perhaps if you want a plain bagel - of whatever type dough - with no seeds, or simply one topping: poppy, sesame. etc. you'll really enjoy the bagels at Katz. I wasn't asking for something new - just what they had been offering for many years.

The rudeness with which I was addressed, whether I was recognized as a long-term customer or not, is not something that I can overlook, and they have lost me as a customer - hence the poor rating I've given.
author: Bruce F.

description: Their bagels are Soo good they can compete with New York! They have vegan cream cheese. They are cash only and tend to sell out early.
author: Tyler S.

description: Awesome place, come early to beat the rush on the weekends and holidays and don't forget cash, as they are cash only. Best bagels in the city, very similar to New York style!
author: Mandy B.

description: I tried to grab a bagel from here on Saturday at 1:05 PM.  When I walked up, the door was locked but I was confused as there were two customers sitting at the counter talking and eating and two employees working at the counter.  I double checked the hours on Yelp and it said they close at 2 PM.  I knocked, got looks from the two employees who saw me and then proceeded to just walk away to the back without even an acknowledgement that they're closed... RUDE.
author: A K.

description: This place is awesome but the hours have been totally wonky. Closed at 12pm, with a mound of bagels on the counter, what gives?
author: Anthony P.

description: Sadly, in the last year I've had three bummer experiences here while popping in for a quick bite. Problems are always the same: out of ingredients, bagels are not toasted, staff is unfriendly and my order is always something other than what I ordered.
author: Jennifer R.

description:
Ordered an egg and cheese (#2) bagel with tomato and avocado. Charged extra $1.75 for the avocado and tomato. Got no avocado or tomato when unwrapped my bagel.

Call me demanding, but this is not rocket science.

Do not recommend!
author: Liza P.

description: Katz offers a vegan cream cheese option (Tofutti), but my bagel tasted like a loaf of soft bread, not a bagel. I will not be back.
author: Christina M.

description: Completely addicted. I could eat here every single day.I will say does not quite reach the NY style heights  of house of bagels In the Richmond, however a very appetizing not too fluffy bagel with a variety of ultra fresh cream cheese options to pair with.  Some of my favorite combos are a jalapeño bagel with bacon cc, and tomato, the #3 egg sandwich with basil & mozzarella, and a whole wheat sesame bagel open faced with cc, avocado & tomato. The one cup at a time coffee ( my fave is the mission blend) is terrific and packs a caffeine wallop.  Cash only.
author: Rebecca H.

description:
I want to waver between 2 and 3 stars for Katz Bagels. There is so much promise to them, but there are also quite a few letdowns (50% of the time, something just makes me make this face: :-/)

Pros: 
- Good bagels with different options
- Quaint mom and pop shop in the midst of all these new expensive premium shops that have been opening up in the Mission.

Cons: 
- Dirty, I don't know when the last time they actually mopped the floors where the customers sit. I don't know if the black stuff I see is just random dirt or mouse droppings. Hopefully, they mop and clean the floors where they make the bagels every day after closing.
- Selective hearing: More than once, I've had to ask for my receipt, and the woman at the register selectively hears not to. Sometimes you will ask for something and they will forget to put it on your bagel. Mostly not out of malice, but probably out of incompetence.

Pro-tip: As other users have already said, they only accept cash.
author: June H.

description:
Save your cash or ATM surcharges and go somewhere else.

1. CASH ONLY - this is 2016 and there are companies like Square that can can help you take credit cards. Last time I was there their ATM machine was also down so I had to walk to the liquor store with the next ATM. Unless you're doing something sketchy like pocketing the money there is no reason to be cash only anymore. Even the hole in the wall bar in the next block (Delirium) now takes credit cards after years of being cash only.
2. Meh bagels - their bagels are not anything spectacular and that is if you get the correct order. I live a block away and come here quite often, I understand mistakes happen but there have been multiple times when I've ordered two bagels and only gotten one. A previous reviewer said they had their order messed up as well.
3. Inventory - They seem to run out of bagels quite often. 

This place has potential but it is stuck in a time warp and my guess is that the owner wont even see any yelp reviews. Yes, small things like a website, facebook or twitter page (lacking both) would help but the first change of accepting credit cards would bring in more customers hopefully making the quality of the bagels and service a lot better. Charge a minimum if you have to...
author: Croz M.

description: A big no no if you come for authentic bagels. I bought whole wheat and onion poppy seeds. Not chewy at all and look very bad (flat and no obvious hole in the middle). Go to Noah's Bagels for authentic ones.
author: Aries X.

description:
I just walked in to get a cup of tea, and they were fixing the glass window above the entrance without any postings.

Nothing like shards of glass raining down on you, and a very not believable 'I'm sorry' when you tell them that this is dangerous and there was glass falling on me.
author: Mister G.

description:
Absolutely the best bagel I've ever had.  Friendly and accommodating staff, perfectly toasted bagels, with delicious smear options!
I chose the everything bagel with honey date spread and I'm still dreaming about it.  Too bad I live in Southern California and can only enjoy when up in San Francisco!  Did I mention the coffee incredible?!
author: Lilian M.

description:
Great stop for bagels. Decent coffee.

I normally order the usual Sesame bagel with egg and bacon but their jalapeño cream cheese is really good so I order that sometimes. I think they put just the right amount of cream cheese. I haven't had anything else but their breakfast but there is usually a line that goes fast. I'll be back again soon!

WHAT I ORDERED:
Sesame Bagel with egg and bacon
Sesame Bagel with Jalapeño cream cheese
Coffee
author: Jennie C.

description: People nice and friendly. Nice space. Great bagels. I had a whole wheat everything with lox spread and an espresso. Delicious. Very fresh and amply applied. Nice jazz music playing in the background too. Grabbed a seat at the bar and ate there. This  may become part of my Saturday ritual along with laughing lotus yoga, which is just up the street from here.
author: Debra R.

description: First yelp review ever.  What a place!  If anyone else is sick of paying 4$ for a bagel with cream cheese from Wise and Sons, this is your solution.  Not too mention the bagel is better quality.  I just ran a blind taste test with three of my friends and Katz crushed....
author: Michael S.

description:
As an East Coast native, I have struggled to find a great bagel in SF.  Katz is the best I've found yet. It's not the best bagel I've had in my life, but it's pretty good and simple and does the trick.

Other bagels I have found in SF are either too doughy or too crunchy. Katz bagels are a nice neutral, not too small, and a good texture for cream cheese.

The service is excellent - the women who work behind the counter are efficient and very nice.
author: Jacqueline R.

description: Only tried a mini bagel cause I don't like too much bread and it was a bit hard so I'm not sure how old it was. The variety looks great and they have lox so I guess they are legit?
author: Allison I.

description:
The low price, the friendly owner, the good service more than offsets any problems I might
have with the bagels.  They re fresh, tasty and the crowd was not SF eatery types, so
this pleased me.  The owner has been in business for years, l994?, and when I asked
about the original price, i think he said .35.  They are not much more, if you consider
inflation, so......a 'a typical' SNOBBISH kind of SF we are "SF" place so worth it.
author: Ruth Z.

description: Not the nicest store front, but the bagels were great. I got there right when they opened so the bagels were still warm. The everything was on point.
author: Amin S.

description: RUDE customer service and not enough transparency about what is actually in their food. Very disappointed. For a great clean bagel and amazing service, go to Wise Sons instead.
author: Jenn G.

description: I ordered three bagels and asked for "extra cream cheese" knowing how chintzy these people are with their cream cheese, and my bagel nightmare came true.  I have posted photographic evidence showing that their cream cheese doesn't even cover the whole bagel properly.  So if you actually like a healthy amount of cream cheese on your cream choose bagel then go elsewhere.
author: Wendell L.

description:
Good bagels in the Bay Area are hard to come by, and Katz is one of the few that gets it right. Katz does them with a well-boiled crusted outside and a chewy/cakey inside that good bagels are defined by. They also have a fresh and tasty assortment of cream cheeses and toppings.

When I realize my fridge at home is short and I need a good breakfast before work, Katz has been a go-to. Out of the numerous times I've gone, I've always ordered the same everything bagel with pesto garlic cream cheese, avocado and onion -- to which they sometimes mix up an ingredient or forget something. Oh well, they're busy, I get it.

I was really turned off by an experience this morning, though. I ordered the above combo with a large coffee that came out to about $8. When they called my order I saw they didn't use the pesto garlic cream cheese I always ask for, but instead used plain. I mentioned that I had asked for the pesto garlic (and that it's what I always ask for), to which the woman who took my order came out and said, "No, you asked for plain." I told her that I had asked for the pesto garlic, that it's what I always get and that I don't really eat cream cheese, but like their pesto garlic. She simply ignored what I said and replied, "No you didn't, you told me plain, so we gave you plain," and then stared at me. 

Again, I get it, mistakes happen, and it's only cream cheese. But don't tell me that I said something I didn't just to avoid admitting a mistake. That's lousy and is enough to make me not really want to come back.
author: Sam M.

description: They are consistent in the fact that they are always there when I need them. I don't think I'm a "boiled bagel" kind of gal but they hit the spot. Today I went with an egg bagel and plain cream cheese, $2.50. There is a complainer on here citing lack of cream cheese but my bagel was dripping! I got cream cheese all over my face as I attempted to eat it while walking my dog home. Bagel gone in less than two minutes. I guess I was hungry. Usually I get a bagel with egg, bacon and cheese but I was thoughtful with my arteries this morning. Give this place a shot, they actually make their bagels there every single day. I think the reviews are lacking because it's either New Yorkers trying to reign supreme or everyone else who's never heard of the boiled bagel concept.
author: Vanessa B.

description: Just bought a sesame bagel with lox with a few people ordering in front of me. Woman behind counter called sesame with lox and another woman came up and grabbed it. Not crazy To think we ordered the same thing. Turned out it was mine and the woman behind the counter blamed me that she had to make it again. She made sure to call me out openly, like I had some scam to get a second order for free. This just happened and I will never go back. Walk past this place almost daily.
author: Ben H.

description:
I love bagels and was thrilled to see Katz's down the street from my AirBnB. A perfect place to grab a quick bite on my way over to Union Square.

There was a line to order, which I mistook as a good sign. I have a feeling many of those in line were there for coffee. 

If there were a soundtrack to accompany my first bite, it would be the sound of a the needle scratching across a record. It was like I was biting into nothing. So bland, so flavorless, so skimpy on the cream cheese. So not a good use of my hard earned dollars.

If you like NY style bagels, you won't like this place.
author: Mary T.

description: I go here once sometimes twice a week. Everyone who works there is friendly and efficient and the bagels are delicious and a great deal! I always go for the everything with lox spread. The lox spread has legit chunks of lox and is fantastic!
author: Rachel C.

description:
Good prices, good bagels, good coffee.

I suppose a New Yorker might sniff at these bagels, just go back to New York already, we're full up on loud-mouthed whiners around here already.

The bagels taste great! Crispy toasted, slightly blistered on the outside, chewy on the inside. It's a bagel, not your momma's bosom.

If you need a quick something to eat and a cup of coffee you tide you over until lunch for under $5, this is your place.

Katz has been around for a long time for a reason.
author: Andy B.

description:
Mediocre bagels, good sized portions and quick order turnaround make Katz Bagels a decent spot for filling breakfast sandwich but not for a high quality bagel. At $5.50 a sandwich, give or take a quarter, the prices match that  of the area with nothing to write home about.

The bagel lacked the balance of chew and crunch perfected in the shops of Brooklyn, Queens, Manhattan, The Bronx or even Staten Island. The bagel flavor was minimal as well, I ordered an everything and it barely tasted like anything. Hardly any onion garlicky goodness left it tasting plain much like the shop.
author: Brenden J.

description:
Nothing like a nice warm carb-y breakfast after a long night. I got the sausage, egg and basil on a regular bagel and it was pretty good. It was filling but I felt like the flavors were on the lighter side. I needed some pepper or hot sauce or something. The bagel was really good though. It was toasted perfectly. 

Overall, the bagel sandwich itself was pretty good. I thought it just needed a bit more spices or flavor.
author: Sophia Y.

description: That was a yummy chewy flavorful bagel! I had the onion with cream cheese. My first Katz bagel
author: Karen T.

description: While waiting for an uber to pick me up i noticed a bagel shop across the street from me & i decided to go in and see what they had to offer. I asked for a cheese bagel and they had it! Toasted, crunchy and warm IT WAS DELICIOUS. I wish they had a place like this over by where I live. I miss having a go-to bagel shop
author: Raquel F.

description: Best bagels in SF! Almost as good as NY I think. Get the lox bagel! Good coffee, too. Prices are good. Great place for breakfast or lunch.
author: Sarah L.

description:
Katz does the bagel thing right. 

I like my whole wheat bagel toasted, cream cheese smothered on that thang, tomato, and avocado please. That's exactly how it goes every time I order my fav. 

Hand hygiene is always perfect (I'm a nurse, can't help but fixate on these things). 

The coffee I can do without.

Cash only, which sucks if I just have plastic on me.

Nice peeps hooking up the comestibles.
author: Gabriela W.

description: I LOVE Katz bagels but the new barista SUCKS!! More than twice Ive gotten my order wrong when I've explained myself thoroughly. I've been coming here since I was in middle school never did the old baristas get my order wrong. I came in the other day and I was ready to order, I looked straight at her and she ignored me until I said "excuse me." Their bagels are delicious but she's been ruining my experience
author: Jocelyne U.

description: Pretty good bagels for a pretty good deal! I came in here last weekend to buy bagels for a group of friends and ended up coming out with a dozen bagels, and 2 containers of cream cheese (plain and a pesto something) for only $19 - less than $2/person for a cream cheesed fresh bagel is not bad at all! I also got a swiss and ham bagel breakfast sandwich for $5 which was also pretty good although not as good of a deal. These aren't my favorite bagels in the whole world but they're pretty damn good so I would probably come back if I was in the area and needed a bagel fix!
author: Priyanka N.

description:
The bagels are real, by which I mean they're not circles of bread or way too sweet.  They're much better than Noah's or other chains.  There is a good texture difference between the crust/skin and the interior.  Although that part could be even better.

The breakfast sandwiches they make on these bagels are pretty good.

The difference between 4 and 5 stars is just... the flavors are good but not amazing.  I would eat here again and I'm sure I will many times, but I don't think of it as super duper outstanding.

The seating area and counters are clean and the employees are nice to customers as far as I've seen.
author: Eric O.

description: I don't like to write Yelp reviews. I understand people are human and make mistakes and things don't always go perfectly. I've worked in customer service jobs; I know it's hard and usually low-paying and people can be entitled jerks. I don't expect everything to be perfect all the time, but I do expect not to be accused of being a liar over a bagel order first thing in the morning. I made an order. They made the wrong thing. I said it's not what I ordered. The woman tries to argue with me that it is what I said. It is most definitely not what I said. I never order what they gave me, and I most certainly did not order it. Look, if you messed up my order; it's no big deal. I'm not going to make you make another one. I'm pretty easy-going, but when people wrongly accuse me of lying, it actually does upset me.
author: Gina S.

description:
My dad is the one who discovered/told me about this place! He decided to try this place out one morning because he was in my neighborhood. He brought me a sesame bagel toasted with creme cheese, tomatoes salt and pepper - absolutely delicious! 

Since the discovery months ago, it has been my go-to place in the morning before school. It usually takes less than 5 minutes for my bagel to be ready. That's awesomeness!
author: Shannon R.

description: lovely atmosphere and good bagels :) a few of my complaints... just not everything is listed on the menu... tofutti? avocado? etc.? i want to know :) why no vegan bagel sandwiches? i asked to make a substitution of hummus vs cream cheese and instead I was up-charged with no explanation. personally that's something I think you should ask the customer about first, especially if you are paying over seven dollars already for a bagel sandwich.... The only reason I caught it was because I heard the cashier ask another worker in Spanish ... but everything tastes great... so theres that! nice coffee, good bagels, busy busy busy on the weekends. cash only. a little pricey but all the costs in the city seem to be ballooning these days... mmm bagels. I wish I had one now.
author: Coco J.

description: Being a native of this great & beautiful city we call home I feel like Katz is one of a few SF spots that has that "SF" home feel to it. For one thing it is always super clean. The staff like Katianna are always welcoming and very fast. Oh yeah almost forgot.... Those bagels. Yummy yummy every time!! The sausage egg & cheese on toasted sesame is AMAZING!!!
author: Raul A.

description:
My fave SF bagel so far and way more vegan-friendly than most bagel places here -- the bagels are egg-free and they offer both Tofutti and hummus as toppings (as well as the more typical options, of course).

Good coffee too. It's made by the cup so you can select from a number of different bean options. I had the Ugandan beans, drank it black, and thought it quite tasty.

I do wish they would serve to-stay orders of coffee in a mug. It's a bummer to get a really nice handmade coffee, only to drink it out of paper. They have some mugs sitting up on a shelf but don't seem to use them.
author: Scott F.

description:
No clue what the bagel's bout to be like.  But the folks here are randomly rude af.  It might have been time they were closing or something, but at first they were out of the listed coffee I was asking for.  Fine, folks run out of things.  Then, I was asked to go pay up front, even though I was already seated and they were bringing food to people's seats all around me.  Finally, after asking for my food for here (in both Spanish and English mind you) several times, they handed me a to-go bag.  Then after asking for my food for here as I had done the whole time, the lady rudely just plopped a "for here" basket in front of me.  Again, hopefully the sandwich is decent, but it'd have to be a sure fire water-imported-from-nj bagel for it to be worth a damn.

Peace
author: Christian S.

description:
(See pics) Review #1105. Same good bagels as the one in SOMA-- good number of selections and were fresh. Coffee was good and they also make specialty coffees. Something to try next time.

On an interesting note, this place looks like it used to be a bar or diner as it has a long bar style table. It also has a wall full of pictures that seemed to be a bit out of place for a quick breakfast place. It does look like it can be a nice and spacious place to have a leisure time if you want to spend an hour (or a few) to hang around or to do some writing.
author: T L.

description: 4 stars for the employee they are very friendly and put up the bagels really good any of one you pick on the menu, on the other hand seems like the owners are really hard on the employee they never smile and they just stand up like. Soldier watching them work I don't think they treat them well, remember the business it get successful if is a good armory and the workers are happy and not look scared about the boss!
author: Agustin E.

description:
Ordered the everything bagel with scrambled eggs. It was delicious, perfectly salted bagel and nicely cooked eggs. 

Will definitely return to try the other bagels.
author: Christy L.

description:
Bagels here are the best on the west coast. Cash only, but it's worth going to an ATM for. No kiddin. Cream cheese is honorable too.  

Being from the northeast USA, where great bagels are plentiful, I've been looking for a decent bagel for more than 7 years of living here. There's something wrong with the way people are making bagels on the west coast, but not here at KATZ! Keep up the great work!! Also your coffee is great. 

I so wish you still had that downtown store on Mission at New Montgomery. Ever since then, my mornings have had a hole in 'em, and sadly that hole wasn't the hole in your bagels ('cause they're not downtown anymore). From what I heard, the rent was too high. I'm sorry that happened. 

On a positive note, I'm happy though that you guys are still in existence in the Mission, and I will keep endorsing you as long as I can muster the words.
author: L. J.

description: Honestly, I haven't been there in several years; just changed my days and don't go by it like I used to; but I knew about it in the first place because my born and raised in New York friend Rome Lorenzo, told me they were the Only place in SF where bagels were made "right".
author: Liz C.

description: I love the coffee here! I always get a coffee and a everything bagel with tomato cream cheese and bacon. Its a nice little breakfast for 7 bucks.
author: Yoli B.

description:
There were no bagels in sight on my last two visits so a name change might be in order. The first time I came here the pizza did have a lot of toppings on it but it was soggy and wet. I assumed this was a bad night and would give them one more try before writing my review. 

The pizza looks great displayed in the jewelry case but when it's given to you the reality that this slice of pie you just bought is soggy and wet and want to slid off you plate quickly becomes a reality. I honestly don't know how anybody can enjoy a soggy and wet slice of pizza but to each their own.

Health Score = 92
author: Justin S.

description: I came into Katz early one weekday morning on my way to work. Few people, very clean, with quick and kind service. Even though I know nothing in the Bay Area comes close to a Brooklyn bagel, I was disappointed. The bagel was thin and fluffy: not substantial enough to hold the lettuce, tomato, and cream cheese (which, admittedly, were good and fresh). The iced coffee was very watery. I will probably not return.
author: Brian C.

description:
Perhaps it was my fault that I asked about veggie lite (it's cream cheese DUH) when I'd asked for hummus and they were closing in five minutes so the gentleman was probably thinking about other things. We ended up getting a baker's dozen (which didn't last as long as you might think!) and veggie lite........ I don't care for cream cheese. I wanted hummus. Something was lost in translation.  And considering I don't care for cream cheese, it was pretty good. But then I left my dog in the car while I was doing laundry thinking "the last time he ate something was a year ago and that was a blue-frosted cupcake! My fault! He's so well-behaved!" and he opened the container and ate all the veggie lite! And I had to clean up after him for DAYS!

Just get bagels. Skip the condiments. Or just don't get veggie lite.
author: Megan S.

description: I enjoyed an everything bagel here while listening to the smooth jazz playing in the background.  would be a great review but my mocha tasted like straight hot chocolate and the tables were dirty even though it was dead inside.  It didn't help that the sanitation sign is stuffed behind the register.  Other than that, good atmosphere and tasty bagels.
author: Martie A.

description: It's pretty good. Just the portions are SO SMALL. I got a lox bagel and substituted the capers for sprouts on a garlic bagel - cost me $7.25... for the same price I can get a GIANT same thing from Focaccia and eat it as breakfast and lunch.
author: Angela L.

description: Michael has perfected the bagel. A balance between a tough New York bagel and a fluffy Noah's bagel. Michael opened on 16th street before Valencia was gentrified. Check out the photps of locals on the walls.
author: Robert B.

description: As an east coaster, these bagels are best case scenario for CA. Beyond that, the staff and management are such genuine, good people.  They are sweethearts and they make it a five-star spot for me. That...and the fact that they are old school--increasingly rare in the neighborhood. :-(
author: Krishan A.

description:
I LOVE these bagels. Perfect. I think they steam their bagels instead of baking them and that's what gives them that amazing crustiness on the outside but moist fluffy inside. They also use a tad bit more salt I've noticed in their bagel dough which makes them all unbelievably delicious. 

I usually get an everything bagel, but their salt, sesame, blueberry and plain are all delicious too. I've also had several variations of their egg sandwiches and they are all delicious. The egg is cooked in a pan, not in the microwave and is always perfectly cooked. All of their different cream cheese options are awesome as well. 

Katz also has a delicious cup of coffee. I love the new trendy coffee places in the Mission, but a lot of times I don't have a life time to watch my individual cup be made. Katz gets you in and out within a minute or two even if there is a line, and it's still delicious. 

Cash only though, remember. Nothing new for people in the Mission, but could be a shocker for some.
author: Juliet S.

description: Pleasant atmosphere and friendly staff. Good selection of coffees. Pesto garlic cream cheese is fantastic.
author: Joe S.

description: I come here fairly regularly and the bagels are ok for SF, but nothing special. That being said the owner is super rude.  I was here today and they turned the music on very loud. Myself and two other customers were a bit taken back and I politely asked the owner of he could please turn down the music slightly. He looked me dead in the eye and said No.  I asked him if he was serious and he was.  Owning a restaurant myself, I can't believe what he said and how rude he was. Never coming here again and neither should you support this jerk.
author: Matt Y.

description:
Hungover walk on Mission Sunday morning.  My final destination was 16th, but I decided to get off on 24th and find coffee.  Prospects didn't look good.  Only obvious places were full on cafes.  Don't need to sit.  Need coffee.  In desperation, thinking about those Chinese bakeries.  They must have coffee...

As I turned onto 16th, I decide to try it out, and lo and behold.  Katz Bagels.  With a line of people waiting to order, some presumably for coffee.  Yes, I will wait.

I waited, and looked at the choices of roasts, well described.  The coffee lady serves both as the cashier and who works on each coffee order, and she's fast but well-versed on how to make each cup.

I finally sit with my coffee, blissfully unaware of everyone else around munching on their bagel sandwiches.  Sunday morning worked out.
author: Don B.

description:
My favorite place in SF for bagels, and the super-flavorful shmears make it one if my favorite breakfasts. The everything bagel with pesto-garlic cream cheese is my order these days, unless I've got a meeting, in which case it's sesame seed bagel with chive. (Gotta avoid the garlic breath & the poppy &/or rye seeds in the teeth!)

The owner is very personable and friendly. I didn't know his dad, but I miss Mr Katz as he was a fixture there, often sitting at the table listening to the jazz and keeping busy with this or that. He was a chronicler of the Mission, as a photographer who even published a great book of photos with the characters & regular people of the Mission as his subjects. 

I have been going there since I arrived in SF almost 20 years ago. I hope it stays around forever.
author: Fran C.

description: Light and airy bagel cafe without the thrills of hipster snobbery. Avoid the salt bagel, stick to the garlic bagel w/ cream cheese or the breakfast sandwiches. Worth the trek.
author: Danielle O.

description: Katz bagels by day, pizza joint by night. Friendly neighborhood staff. Just know what you're going to order before going to the cashier. They get busy during the morning hours. I met Mr Katz once and he gave me one of his photography books documenting the souls of the Mission. He took the time to get to know me and made me feel welcomed in my new home four years ago. I hope to see his bagel shop for many more years to come. May he rest in peace.
author: Cindy A.

description:
This is one of my favorite on-the-go breakfasts: the Katz #5 (egg, cheese, and meat) with bacon and a jalapeño bagel. It's a pretty greasy mess of delicious breakfast. They cook the egg and bacon fresh for you so it's so hot and tasty every time.

I would probably eat it every day except for two things:
1. My heart would explode
2. Service isn't super fast (Katz was right along my walk to Bart, and the deciding factor would usually be if there was anyone in line when I walked by)

They are cash only, but have an ATM that almost always works.
author: John B.

description: Great bagels! Nice low key shop, consistent, moderate prices. Cash only, my favorite bagel place in the city!
author: Yodlee Y.

description:
I pretty much only come here for their whitefish salad bagel with tomato and onions. It's awesome the morning after a night out. 

I do wish it was a little bigger though.
author: Andy H.

description:
This place is the 'KATZ' meow!

Step into a zen like atmosphere outside of the bustling 16th street atmosphere for a warm bagel and a hot caffeinated drink.

The bagels were good and the spread was delish. An everything bagels with chive schmear topping with thinly slices onions and an apple juice ran me just under 5 bills.

Yelp has steered me right again!
author: Bobby C.

description: They make a great bagel. The spreads are not as thick as they used to be, but still ample. Nice staff. They contribute to the local elementary school silent auction, this year proving to be one of the few local businesses that is willing to help support our local school.
author: Scott B.

description:
I have made peace with the cash only situation , but that is only because the bagels, bagel sandwiches, and the great staff are bomb.com.org.edu. All you people talking about the pizza at night being good are lying , but it's not your fault you are drunk but I'd stick with the bacon wrapped hot dog carts instead. 


But back to the bagels. MMMM they are delicious. And their coffee is A-Ok too! yummmm, I think I'm gonna get my tired butt up right now and walk down the street to get me some .
author: Lauren V.

description: I am a little particular about my bagels having lived in NYC for over a decade. Katz comes pretty close but I would still prefer a NY (or Montreal) bagel over what they make. The egg sandwiches are delicious!
author: Leonard C.

description: Solid bagels for a good price. Feels like about as good as things get around here. I can't vouch for their authenticity but I don't know a better alternative for the price.
author: Scott T.

description: Hankering for a bagel and this place was nearby. Wait, any relation to Katz's Deli NYC? No idea, but I love good bagels. That is what I got. They make it as it's ordered, so if there is a line and you're wondering why your simple bagel w/ cream cheese is taking so long, it's because all those people in front of you ordered something more complicated. Deal with it. Yum. I'll be hear often.
author: Mark S.

description:
This morning at Katz I witnessed what was hands-down the grossest thing I have ever seen in food services from this side of the exchange. This is a huge statement given that I've eaten at least one meal out every day since the 90s. Here's what I saw:

An elderly man, presumably related to the boss & his family, went behind the counter with a pair of dirty children's flip-flops. He proceeded to clean the flip-flops on the sandwich board while it was being used. When he was finished, he didn't even bother to wipe it down. He just walked away like nothing happened. I was sitting at the counter not 5 feet from this spectacle in absolute shock. My lady friend couldn't even finish her bagel. It was that disgusting. 

Tip for the middle aged man running the place: If that's your dad, dude, keep him the fuck out of your kitchen.
author: Jen M.

description: The fact that its cash only is ridiculous. You're forcing your customers to pay 2.50 to get money from the atm because you're too lazy to not get a credit card machine. I don't understand this. EVERYBODY HAS CREDIT CARDS!!! coffee was horrible. One star for the bagel and cream cheese because it was okay. But I am not coming here because of the fact that it is cash only!!!
author: Mohammad A.

description:
This is a little hipster dive spot for bagels.  

Cash only.  Service can be a little slow, but my bagel with cream cheese, tomato and bacon was delish!
author: Jaime P.

description: Decently priced lox bagel sandwich if you're looking for an on-the-go breakfast or lunch in the Mission District. Obviously not the freshest smoked salmon I've tasted (compared to...say, Cap'n Mike's Holy Smoke at the Ferry Building farmer's market), but decent.
author: Phoebe C.

description: Feel sad giving them 3 stars, but they are a bit inconsistent. Great bagels (boiled on location), and great drip coffee, but they have a few cons: sometimes burn your bagel, the line has nowhere to go since the door awkwardly is about 4 feet from the cash register, and it opens to the inside, making matters worse and they can't really go through a line that quickly (theres almost always a line because their awesome smelling bagel scent lures commuters in). Ordered a Latte today, but they really over-steamed the milk. Decent prices though.
author: Joel V.

description:
This is my favorite bagel place in the city. It's in a central location in the Mission and has fast, friendly service.

I tend to shy away from bagels because of the carbs but when it comes to a Katz Bagels - they are so good, I don't care.

My favorite egg sandwich is the #3: w/ spinach, grilled onions, Swiss cheese, and tomatoes. While I like my breakfast meats, this sandwich is already so tasty it doesn't need any bacon or ham.

Do yourself a favor and give Katz's Bagels a try. Yum!
author: Tina T.

description: 5 stars for convenience and friendliness. I come here all the time. It's always good and there pretty fast, even when there's a line outside the door :)
author: Tina F.

description: Really, the bagels are great. The lox on the toasted sesame had just the right hint of salt on the bagel. Yeah baby. But their coffee blows me away. They feature "Rodger's"coffee beans and I'd stack a cup of their house against any. My new routine to kick off the weekend.
author: Joseph F.

description:
I love Katz, they've conditioned me to only love their bagels.  (I'm a particular fan of the garlic bagel, slathered in cream cheese with tomatoes and pepper.)  

It's a great location, and I love sitting at the bar and people watching.

If you need a pick-me-up in the morning and you're near 16th in the Mission, go here, you'll be happy.
author: Margaret I.

description: I live around the corner from Katz and I am a fan! I like everything about this place. From people who work there to their yummy egg and cheese bagels!! I must add they also have killer coffee! I highly recommend.
author: Tumay A.

description:
I was at Kilowatt and went across the street to Katz to get a slice of pizza.  I tried the pesto one, and was bummed to see the dude put the slice in the microwave....I've never seen a pizza-by-the-slice place use the microwave before.  However, the pizza wasn't bad - I had a few beers already, so maybe I'm remembering it better than it actually was though.

At $3 for a slice of microwaved pizza, I'd say skip this place - especially with so many other choices around.
author: Leslie G.

description:
Just what I needed! I've lived down the street for a year and a half and I've just now stopped here for a bagel? Shame on me. 

I was really hungry this morning and the bacon/ egg/ cheese bagel (on sesame) with a cup of coffee did the trick. Super friendly staff, really nice atmosphere, delicious bagel, decent coffee. Cannot fail :)
author: Eilene G.

description: I used to go get a coffee and bagel here on the weekends because a cute girl made my bagel very early on Sunday mornings with, what I felt was a lotta love! Cured whatever I may have been feeling that day. Will say though, that when I run into the, who appears to be  owner , I feel I get some kind of cold treatment-- whatever, bagels there are good, but Id think he would treat me with more respect than his several employees! I try go go there early in the morning now, because I've noticed he doesnt work those hours.
author: Banksy R.

description: Just had a great cup of coffee and a good bagel with lox spread. Don't expect a NY bagel, but great for West coast.
author: John N.

description:
Bagel? I didn't see a single bagel in the place! 

Then again, this is a place that, if you're cruising down 16th, is right before the infamous danger dog cart http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/ebASiVi_KQONOcPhgooSYg/l

Affordable, quick, and ready to heat up any cold slices, Katz provides sustenance for anybody hopping around the Mission in search of fermented organics induced hunger. This is not even as close to CPK (the easy standard), but it works when you need it. 

There are some wonderful murals on the walls and the pizzas come out on a regular basis. Just be mindful that this isn't going to even close to the best pizza you've ever had, but it's good enough for those times when you need to eat. The vegetarian slice comes packed with toppings http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/c7-A6IJICR7u0qCkCr81AA/l, although during the late evening, the meat topped slices are far few and in between. 

Not too bad, but I think I'd rather pay for a danger dog...
author: Jason C.

description: Can't beat a bagel and coffee for five bucks. The bagels and coffee are really good, fresh and served with a smile. I loved ducking in here to get out of the cold rain to find a warm and inviting space. The pour-over coffee was excellent and they cook the eggs not microwave them. I would highly recommend it to any looking for consistently good food and great service.
author: David B.

description: Love the onion bagel toasted with cream cheese tomatoes, red onions and crispy bacon.  Absolutely divine!  Other good staples are the honey and date cream cheese or the dill cream cheese.  Other review complain about the prices, but I think they are spot on.  They have great orange juice and iced tea.  Only downfalls are that they are cash only and close at 2pm.
author: Victoria O.

description: Bagels are good but service is very rude - i ordered a dozen bagels and there was a lot of sighing and banging around of bags on the counter as if i had asked for something completely out of the ordinary. Guess what? If you work at a bagel shop, people are going to order a dozen bagels in assorted flavors!
author: Bridget F.

description:
Pizza review: actually really good and cheap if you buy a whole pizza.

The downside is that the pizzas are pre-made and then just popped in the oven when you order so you cannot really personalize or make any substitutions. The benefit of this is that the pizza comes out super fast.

Oh if you are one of those people that freaks out when the help doesn't speak English, don't come here.
author: Caitlin H.

description:
I like this place. Totally unpretentious with excellent bagels and shmears. I don't profess to be a New Yorker and I am aware they are uniformly of the opinion that nothing compares to a New York bagel but the quality is never definable. Everyone has their preference. 

Did I mention I like this place?  Had the egg bagel with sun dried tomato shmear last. Loved it!  There were discernible flecks of tomato and herbs in the cream cheese. The bagel is boiled so there is a crunch on the outside. The price is very reasonable. 

So unless you're from New York and can't abide by Weat Coast bagels, give it a try!
author: Kevin W.

description:
I started frequenting Katz for Bagels once a weekend when I discovered they brewed Rodgers coffee, my go-to-by the cup of choice! I prefer Rodger's since I don't get the hipster grief of waiting in line for a delicious cup of overpriced coffee. 

The bagels, though are what get me to come back each weekend. I adore the bagel choices, though you must get there early to get the full gamut. My favorite is the jalapeno bagel with bacon, cream cheese and tomatoes. It is loaded with bacon, the cream cheese and tomatoes are the background and are perfectly paired to cut the saltiness out of all that bacon!

I usually order the lox bagel for my friend and I get a bite once and a while. It is delicious, smeared thick with cream cheese AND lox. They don't scrooge you on the good stuff!

Why should you go? There is good coffee and breakfast all over the mission, I know. But this little corner shop that has three of the same, not overly nice not rude at all women working! I like them early in the morning, they put a smile on my not made up face and I forget that my hair literally just came off my pillow  minutes prior. The place is big enough to dine in, quick enough to get to go, the music is good and the crowd is diverse.
author: Jessica f.

description: I'm from the New York area, so my standards are high. This is the best bagel I've had in the Bay Area thus far.
author: David H.

description:
I walk by this place every morning on my way to BART and see a line out the door for fresh bagels... seems promising, right? 

I finally stopped by here on a Sunday morning (surprisingly not as busy as it is during the week) and got one of the "fresh" bagels.  I hate to say it but... meh... these were small, dry and pretty flavorless.  My boyfriend got an everything which should be renamed "everything-falls-off" this (quickly) plain bagel.  The egg, cheese and bacon in the bagel were fine... nothing special.  

I will say the honey-date cream cheese spread was delicious.  Definitely the best part of the place. As others have said, it is pretty cheap... but honestly, I left craving your standard Bruegger's or even Panera bagel which ultimately are probably comparable price wise, but a lot better than what I'd hope would be a great local joint.  

Oh well. Guess I'll have to try the pizza eventually too...
author: Elizabeth B.

description:
Yet another Katz Bagel!  Yay!

I'm a Katz fan.  The Mission Katz is much nicer on the inside than the downtown Katz.  There's more seating, the air is cooler, and the are on the walls is funkier.  These are all positives.

The negatives appear to be slower service and less lox in the lox spread. Don't bogart the lox!

Tried Katz's coffee for the first time and though it was really good.  Not blue bottle but much better than most.
author: Ivan L.

description:
Best Bagel Place!!!

Get the onion bagel with cucumber dill cream cheese... yum, so good.  The bagels come out warm and crispy on the outside, soft on the inside.  The cucumber/dill cream cheese is flavorful and fresh.  

They have a lot of menu options from bagels with cream cheese to bagel sandwiches.  The coffee is great too.  If you're there in the morning- be prepared for a small line.  Seems to move pretty fast though.  I would highly recommend this place for all your bagel needs!
author: Sarah G.

description: They advertise "boiled bagels" but these are nothing like East Coast bagels. Showed up at 7:15 am on a Saturday to pick up fresh bagels (they open at 7) and the bagels were already cold and possibly a day old. Also, too few staff around and, near as I could tell, the "veggie" cream cheese only had some carrot shreds in it.
author: Peg W.

description: Probably one of the best breakfasts that I have had in San Francisco. I am not kidding. I love their breakfast sandwiches and cream cheese. Their breakfast sandwiches are well seasoned. By themselves, their bagels are delicious.
author: Cindy C.

description: holy crap. best bagels I have ever had in my entire life.  I want to fly back from Chicago just for these.  Out of this world and super affordable!
author: Katie B.

description: The bagels are delicious, the coffee is amazing. Seriously, the regular drip coffee is so much better than so many cafés.
author: Toby K.

description:
I live just around the corner and get bagels here at least twice a week.  I used to get a latte but found they were a little milky and needed two shots.  Great bacon but not the best cream cheese.  Staff are always pleasant even when busy.  

Had my first pizza from there tonight and I have to say it was the best pizza I have ever eater.  The man behind the counter was extremely pleasant and chatty.  Pizza is pre-made but was fresh and he is making them there and then for use later I guess.  It was heated in a pizza oven not a micro-waveBeen all over italy but this Pizza is better than anything I found there.

Music always great and love the atmosphere.

Will definitely be a regular in the evening too.

Shame no cakes or cookies in the mornings as would pop in more often.  Also find the 1pm close a little early if get forget the time as not many lunch options nearby.
author: Stephen M.

description: Horrible service today, no acknowledgement just stared at me for my order, no hello or good morning, also no thank you after I paid. Got home to find she crammed in bagels that are crispy and rock hard- like they are leftovers from yesterday or something or sat in the oven too long.
author: Amanda F.

description:
I have wanted to stop by Katz for a while.  I frequent the Mission and 16th St BART a lot and this is always on my route away from or going towards my lovely East Bay shuttle.  I finally stumbled into Katz this past Sunday.

I like the low prices.  I actually paid more for an egg and cheese bagel in Berkeley than here.  Well, 3.25 vs. 3.5.  I loved that the scrambled eggs were super fresh and not the stored up patties.  I did feel like there could have been more cheese on the bagel.  The bagel itself, an everything, was solid, but not spectacular.  I also came here after having slept about 5 hours, so that could have influenced my impressions and opinions.
author: Jeremy G.

description:
I may have still been drunk or buzzed, but this place has the best late night pizza ever!  ...Actually, let's say in SF, since I had an awesome late night pizza in Miami once.  

I don't know if it'd be the same if I were completely sober, since I don't go to the Mission much during the day, but I hope it is.  I'll have to try it sometimes and re-edit this review when I do.
author: Joe N.

description:
KILLER PIZZA, MAN.

I came here with some friends to try and soak up some of the leftover alcohol in our stomachs from the night before.  They all got bagels, but I went for the pizza.  Everybody seemed very pleased with the bagels and vegan cream cheese options, but I was flipping out over the pizza.  One of the best slices I've ever had.

I saw the sign saying you could order it by the slice so I went for it.  I didn't know they'd make it entirely fresh!  The workers got to work kneading some dough and slapping together a pizza to my liking.  I felt pretty crappy about it, actually.  Fifteen minutes or so later, my pizza was ready.  By now my friends had all finished their bagels, but that was alright.  No hurry I guess.  

I got the KATZ PIZZA, which has a bunch of stuff on it that I don't remember, plus basil, artichoke hearts, tomatoes, arugala, and prosciutto.  In my still-drunken state it didn't click to me that prosciutto was meat, so when I got my pizza I took that stuff off.  I wasn't about to have them remake an entire pizza just because of my ignorance.

I took a picture of my pizza and it's posted up in the photos section, if you want to check it out.  It was thin crust, but not too thin.  Way gourmet tasting, blows the heck out of Z Pizza and whatever else we have here in Southern California.  Highly recommended.
author: Bryan R.

description: I love their bagels and I might be indulging on carbs but you can always ask them to scoop the inside of the bagel and have a wonderful number 3 with bacon! Another favorite of mine is jalapeño cream cheese with bacon and tomatoes. Enjoy!
author: Katarine Q.

description: I love this bagel shop. Whenever I am in the city, this is my go-to place for a bagel and cup of coffee. The service is always great and the prices reasonable.
author: Katie Z.

description:
Let me paint you a picture.  It was Halloween 2009.  I was dressed as a dodge ball player, complete with short shorts, knee high socks, a headband, wrist bands, and a dodge ball.  I trekked my way over to the Mission after a night of mellow partying.  I wanted to eat.

It took me a while to realize that the place we stumbled into was actually Katz Bagels.  Since all we ordered was a pizza.  Conversation below.

Me: let's just get a medium.  We're not THAT hungry.  I don't want to have pizza sitting in the backseat of my car.
P: OK.

I go off to the restroom.  P goes to the counter.  M is holding the table down.

P (to the cashier): We'll have a medium...erm...large...I mean extra large margherita pizza.
Me (in the restroom): am I hearing him correctly?

I come out, M and P sitting at the table with goofy smiles on their faces.  I told them I already knew about the extra large order.  Hardy har har.

We finished it all in 10 minutes.  Go team.  No leftovers in the car for me!

Let me know if you want to borrow my dodge balls.  They're just sitting in my room collecting dust!
author: Jenny L.

description:
They are not kidding about their everything bagel. It has everything. On both sides. Everything.

Some tips
Bagel size: on the small side
Everything bagel with cream cheese, tomato, onion: $3.25
Service: there's usually a line on the weekend but it moves fast
Cash only 

WARNING: If you plan to pick up a dozen or more of one type of bagel, go early or call ahead. I stopped by to pick up a dozen everything bagels at 9:30 am on a Saturday and they would only give me 6.
author: Jen Y.

description:
The breakfast bagels (and coffee!) are great. Toasted just right...and like Jeremy G. said below, the eggs are very fresh -- not artificial-looking space patties.

The lady owner working this place, though...sheesh. Talk about an icy-cold reception. I almost feel like I'm annoying or inconveniencing her when I order even a coffee.

This may very well be a cultural-difference issue (she appears to be Middle Eastern), but I feel most unwelcome whenever I visit Katz.
author: Dan H.

description: Love this place...  So hard to find unpretentious places near Valencia anymore.  This has such a great atmosphere- laid back great place to spend Sat. morning.  Great cool jazz playing, great coffee, big wood bar, and the egg bagels are really chewy inside and crunchy outside.  I had one with lox spread, toms, and onions.  Portraits of real SF-ers on the walls.
author: Laurence S.

description: Delicious bagels, good coffee and reasonable prices. What else do you need for a breakfast?!
author: Rafal N.

description: whitefish salad on everything bagel.. coffee is great as well.  Friendly staff.  You won't be disappointed!
author: David H.

description: Had a drunk slice Saturday night and I remember it being pretty dang tasty. Not many options though and nearly every pie had bell peppers on it. I hate bell peppers. Their grated parm was good quality but I don't recall there being garlic powder which I like to sprinkle on my crust. All in all, it was a good late night eats option after hitting the Mission bars.
author: Nicole O.

description:
When I entered Katz Bagels, Led Zeppelin was playing form the loudspeakers. That and the décor (green and yellow walls and old, framed concert posters) give the place an extra star because I wasn't that impressed with the food. 

I ordered a large latte for $3, which was about the same size as a tall at Starbucks (which I also think costs around $3). To that an egg sandwich consisting of scrambled eggs, tomato, basil, and mozzarella. It was tasty, but fairly small, I could have eaten two. I didn't... going to Europe next week so I guess this was a good preparation. Many other places serve their coffee in a real cup when you don't get it to go, which I suggest Katz Bagel to do too for a more welcoming and friendly impression.
author: Anna S.

description: Delicious bagels:) though waiting time is about 10 mn door is too closed to register big lines but it's worth it.
author: Lisa M.

description:
I've never tried the pizza here, so just check my review for the bagels.  Also, I'm not a bagel person, so you should probably ignore my opinion.  In fact, just don't bother reading my review.  All that aside...  

It was 8am, I was jetlagged, and I was really hungry.  And somehow, SOMEHOW, I had a bagel urge.  This generally doesn't happen to me, so I dunno where it came from!  Maybe it was because pretty much every other place in the Mission was closed at 8am...  So anyhow, I got two bagels from here, the sesame, which was ok, and the multi seeded something, which was very tasty.  I then bought some raw chorizo, bell pepper, spinach, and green onion in one of the little Mexican marts around, and cooked it all together and ate it like a bagel taco.  BTW, it was tasty.  So in conclusion, if you have an 8am urge to make bagel tacos, you should probably go here.  Otherwise, ignore me.  3.5 Stars.
author: Leon K.

description: The bagels are good, but the area is like a war zone, mixed with zombies, puke, piss, and trash everywhere.
author: Captain B.

description:
Step in out of the chaos that is 16th street.   Have a seat.  Order a thin slice of cheese pizza for $2.46.  Not too much sauce, it's very very good. Yes have a beer on tap.  Relax, you're amongst friends.   Feel better?   Ok now get back outside into the din and fray and fight and dodge your way back home.

Strange hours...
author: Jeff J.

description:
I have a feeling I'm really going to regret writing this review.

This place allegedly makes bagels and operates as a cafe during the daytime, I have no idea if this is true.

What I can tell you is that at night they make the best "by the slice" pizza in the Mission. The crust is thin and not doughy or gritty at all, the sauce is tangy and fresh tasting, just writing this review is making my mouth water. 

For best results I suggest waiting until a pizza comes out of the oven and ask for two pieces of it , you will want two, regardless of the toppings. Also if you are coming from a bar don't wait till last call because the place gets crowded and I've been there when they've run out of pizza.

Now go forth and make this place so crowded I can't get in.
author: Manny F.

description: Not the crisp bagel I was hoping for... and too much gloppy cream cheese. Bacon and egg was good though.
author: E T.

description: Best bagels I've had in SF.  I generally come here 2-3 mornings per week and devour an egg sandwich or a lox bagel and have a coffee.  Hard to think of anything bad to say about this place.  The bagels are very good, and all of the menu items I've tried are great.  They also serve Rodger's coffee via drip - I recommend Uganda Bugisu, that s*** gets me going every time!  Service is good and they crank out orders pretty quickly.  I find their prices reasonable for the quality of food: 7.25 for a lox bagel and 4.50 for an egg sandwich with mozzarella, tomato, and basil.
author: Michael M.

description: It's no longer called Katz. And it transforms from a truly solid bagel shoppe in the morning to a late-night pizza joint at night. And both products are very good. Pizza is crispy crust, tangy sauce, generous cheese. Bagels and coffee are of the highest caliber for SF - which is a low bar.
author: Andrew K.

description: Good bagels, nice twist to making a a bagel. Kinda hard to screw up a bagel anyways. But pretty good assortment. Kinda pricey but definitely would go back when in the neighborhood.
author: John G.

description:
the bagels here are nicer than at posh bagels (which aren't bad, just more poofier).

the women that work here are very kind and patient.

they cook the egg for the bagel sandwiches in a skillet and not in a microwave (which they used to do).

i've been coming here since 2004 and it's consistently good.

fairly priced.  i can spend five bucks on a bagel sandwich and coffee, not ten.

these are the reasons why katz is the best.  thank you katz.
author: señorito K.

description: It's decent pizza! Okay, that wasn't a stellar review. It's perfectly fine pizza, better than some of the other quick pizza stops. But to be honest, i don't come for the pizza so much as i do for the jazz on friday nights. I also dig the posters from the Fillmore on the walls.
author: Phuong M.

description: Amazing price, service, time and taste. They are cash only, and very inexpensive for yummy bagels. I got a variety of bagels for some co workers with cream cheese to the bacon,egg cheese and we all really liked them. I didn't try the coffee but each cup is made to order and looked delicious. People need to stop hatin on the service, they were more than courteous. !
author: Chayne J.

description: Good bagel for the West coast.  Unpretentious and inexpensive.  A bagel with specialty cream cheese and a coffee will cost you about $5.
author: Melissa B.

description:
My past experience with bagels was eating those crappy ones that are frozen that my mom bought from Costco. So, I never understood why anybody would ever ever want to eat a bagel...

UNTIL NOW.

Fresh bagels every morning at Katz! Yum! Toasted, with cream cheese, with cheese, with bacon, with egg--anything! They slather on the cream cheese too. It's amazing. There are about 8 or so different kinds too...but I like my onion bagels. =)

If you're an espresso buff, I wouldn't come here. It's usually not good or "made with love," as my boyfriend would describe it.

But if you want a bagel, you MUST GO HERE. I will not eat a bagel anywhere else. I actually crave Katz bagels sometimes.

I also really really love and appreciate that they make sure to touch your bagels/food with gloves, and take off their gloves when handling money. I've never seen people so good about this. Usually you'll see people at other food places use gloves, but then they end up handling money and food with the gloves.

Their pizza late at night...well it's definitely good if you're drunk. I don't know if you want to eat it when sober though.
author: Angela H.

description:
Trying to do this from a Blackberry is ridiculous...what was I thinking?

Gotta love Katz they've been here sooooo long, I'm just embarassed that I've never tried them til now!

I ordered the creme cheese avocado red onion n tomato on toast wheat bagel.  Hubby ordered the turkey and cheese we both loved it!  Perfect n toasty AND the best creme cheese available!

Went back today for my same bagel plus....my friend ordered a bagel with creme cheese, lox, avo, tomato n red onion, it was almost 7.00!!! But she liked it.  No wonder I never order Lox! Lol!

I really do miss the little martian ina flying bagel they use to have above the awning...made it easy to locate.  But I'm sure the City & Count found some violation and ordered them to act.

Perhaps they can hang it inside somewhere it was way too kool!  This place
author: Bahvee V.

description:
The event planner insisted that I get two dozen Katz Bagels. This place seems like a place for depressed poor bloggers to get their angst out onto the ethernet. Even the cashier had that three day old greasy hairstyle look and pathos on the brain. Maybe Katz sold his place..not as much of a Mission Mensch as he may have been ten years ago.

They were ok and she was happy. PARKING SUCKS unless you park about ten blocks away or pray that your parking karma is turned on high.

I don't get what all the fuss was about, but whatevah...the Valencia scene-sters get the Katzs and my secret passion...Bi-Rite burnt caramel ice cream...
author: miriam b.

description:
I really wanted a bagel with honey date cream cheese the other day. It's 1:15 in the afternoon. I'm on a 15 minute break. I work 2 blocks (if that) away, but this seems like a marathon as I'm HUNGRY and in need of HONEY DATE CREAM CHEESE. I can picture it - mediocre bagel, slightly burnt or under-toasted because they never seem to perfect the toast timing, oozing with SUPPLE, MOIST, SCRUMPTIOUS, um...what other words make people cringe?....HONEY DATE CREAM CHEEEEEESE. 

And so by now, I'm hot, sweaty and winning in a wet t-shirt contest. I jump over a homeless guy getting arrested in front of Delirium, check myself out in the window of Monk's Kettle, SO CLOSE, and then I get ready to make the left into Katz and....GREAT. THEY'RE CLOSED. 

This means I have wasted the vast majority of my 15 minute break, I have lost my matte complexion and dry clothing, not to mention my dignity, and I am hungry, delirious, and in front of Delirium. GOD, WHY?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?! 

So I kick and scream my way back to work and starve until my lunch because when I crave honey date cream cheese, it's just a ridiculous assumption to believe that I could be satisfied with just any old cream cheese. Psh. 

Later that night, I see the OPEN sign beaming in Katz and smell the wafting scent of pizza. What the hell kind of hours are these, Katz, and why the hell can't I buy a side of H.D.C.C. with my pizza? 

Point deducted for offering toffuti cream cheese (in plain and chive!) Not because I don't like it or don't think it's awesome to offer alternatives...only because it means when I politely and routinely throw out the, "anyone want anything?" and disclose that I'm trekking to Katz, the vegans at work will snatch up the opportunity and I'll spend my break watching the cream cheese spread. I guess if it's honey date cream cheese, I'm ok with that.
author: haley d.

description:
Dear Aloof Former Neighbor,

I thought that the first time I saw you in here was a mere coincidence, and that I would never see you again, but to my mounting dismay, it seems that you too have made Katz your preferred breakfast spot.  

This is absolutely unacceptable.  (What's a posh beezy like you "slummin'" it in my neighborhood anyway?)

Let's just get one thing straight:  Katz is *MY* bagel spot!!!  

Gitcherown!

Unapologetically,
Ghetto.

-------------------------------------------
~Sigh~

Let's just say that Katz Bagels has friendly employees, whole wheat everything bagels, a willingness to accommodate my "open-faced-bagel" requests, and an awesome pesto-garlic cream cheese that  I *really* wish others didn't have access to.
author: Karen F.

description: I went over to Katz Bagels because I thought I would hop in to get a quick bagel.  But I ended up waiting in line for 20 minutes.  I understand that maybe someone called in sick or they were short handed for whatever reason.  But the wait time was frustrating.  When I did get a chance to place my order, I didn't have to wait very long.  I didn't order coffee because I saw how long it takes them to drip their coffee per order...so I went with a soda to cut down on the turn around time.
author: Marty W.

description: This place is always consistent. Never too long of a wait. The food is good, not great. It fills a need for the location, but doesn't go beyond that. The coffee is decent. The service is good and the employees are very nice. It is tough trying to find a good bagel in the west coast. I still can't say I have found one. Maybe it is something in the water out here. My favorite bagel is a pumpernickel bagel with lots of flavor. There pumpernickel bagel tastes like a plain bagel died brown. Where are the caraway seeds? Anyway, I continue to eat here 4-5 days a week because it is fast, cheap, and not awful. As long as there is no breakfast competition on the block, this place will do fine.
author: Ryan B.

description:
Running too late for breakfast?
Get breakfast anyway!
I think this is the perfect place to run in and get some actual food quick.
Plenty of butter and calories for those who care.
You know but if it didn't - it wouldn't be any good.
So, the devil makes a perty good point.
author: Theo R.

description:
I don't think these ladies have ever listened to me when I say non-fat latte but I'm glad they don't. Their lattes are bangin'. 

Katz is a straight-forward bagel joint, I'm not sure you can really fuck up a bagel, but this is my fave morning bagel spot. Wheat, cream cheese, tomato.

This is also my fave 3am pizza spot. Try their drunk slice - you'll love yourself for it.
author: C P.

description: If you like bagels with lox, Katz's is a great place to go.  (Note difference between the two options of lox spread, and lox bagel.)  They pile enough stuff into it so that it comes in two separately wrapped halves. Very tasty and toasty.  The coffee's also really good for a place that doesn't market itself as a coffee place per se.  You also gotta love all the music posters from the 60s and 70s.
author: moosedog i.

description:
what happened to this place??    I'm not sure what's worse the bagels or the atmosphere.  The bagels were slightly stale (even though I bought a dozen at 8am) and they weren't labeled in the counter so I'm not really sure what I got.  I also waited in line for 15 minutes, you heard me, 15 minutes.  There were about 5 people ahead of me.  This place is seriously understaffed and the atmosphere is dark, slightly grungy, and completely unappealing.  

This place used to be great.  I lived next door for 5 years but something has gone awry.
author: Paddy G.

description:
Greatest bagels on the west coast--and this is coming from an east coast guy. 

The pizza I cannot rate, and it only loses a star because it quite often becomes seriously packed.

As far as things go out here, spreads, schmears, bagels, etc, this is the only real bagel shop in the city.
author: Chad G.

description: Not located in the best and safest parts of the city, but if you can make it past the drug dealers, homeless folks, and drunks, you'll find this bagel place nearby.  I had the egg and sausage bagel (wheat w/everything) and it was nothing special.
author: Ricky M.

description:
It's rare to see a place with such mixed reviews, so I feel obligated to chime in.  I never approach Katz Bagels thinking that it will replicate the bagels I enjoyed in the Tri-State area-thus, I am not disappointed.  I've noticed that their bagels feature such small holes as to sometimes be mistaken for a hard roll.  But on weekend mornings when I can't deal with the crowds or the calorie count at Tartine, it's an okay place to get a bagel for carryout.  I take the bagel home, toast it up, and smear it with Trader Joe's hummus, and I'm no longer hungry.  Certainly not worthy of a trip across town, but if you're in the neighborhood...

Yes, it's a hassle that Katz's is cash only.  They somewhat make up for this shortcoming by offering the NY Times for sale and Diet Coke in cans.  Any questions?
author: Beth V.

description:
I used to go to the Katz Bagels on Mission St near the Meteron, and I recall their bagels being super good, and the coffee being excellent. 
The girl that took my order here was very nice, they got my bagel order right, and I didn't have to wait.  That is where the two stars come from.
Oh, and half a star for the tomato on my bagel.  I was not super excited or impressed by my bagel, nor my coffee.  I know drip house coffee usually isnt the greatest, but sheesh.
author: Janet R.

description:
NOTE: I have never actually purchased a Katz Bagel from a Katz location - just through other coffee shops and local grocers that sell their product.

I feel especially close to the bagel in general as I seem to have developed a bagelish excess around my mid section. I may be a bagel enthusiast. 

One of the main reasons I enjoy Katz Bagels above others is the texture. In my vain (not vain enough that I would cut my bagel consumption to lessen my bagel baggage) attempt to eat whole grains - I try to stick to the Whole Wheat bagel. Katz Bagels make me feel heart-healthy AND allow me to enjoy flavor by making a whole wheat "everything" (WWE) bagel. Yum. 

Also awesome, due to my frequent enjoyment of a Katz WWE with cream cheese in the car on my way to work I have started my own mobile farm...sesame plants have begun sprouting in my car interior!
author: Jessa B.

description:
